Body:
Can a multi-sentence direct quote be a single complement of "say," "write," etc.? For example, in this utterance...

He said "Forget the map. Just find the rascal."

...do the two directly quoted sentences constitute a single complement of the verb "said"?
Title: Can more than one directly quoted sentence be a complement of "say"?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe: I'm your dog for Dutch, Latin, and Greek.

OwnerUser.AboutMe: I'm a conlanger who needs reliable information about real languages. By profession, I'm a speech/language therapist, so some of my questions may be work-related as well.
